column4: guys, I have a big problem, I don't know why, but lately this machine isn't connecting to the internet.
I thought first it was the isp, but then I can see my neighbour, who I share connection with.
I look at the net configuration, and everything seems to be ok.
how exactly do you share the connection? dsl rouer?
I don't know what's goin on.
I'm sure it's something with the linux, since for that downtime.
now can you ping the router from your machine?
nozorro....I don't know how to do that.
it has nothing to do with the the bandwidht full.
open System | Administration | Network Tools please
xeng... nothing weird as I remember
Wait wait !  it may have been moved to somwhere else in he menue ... you can  also open it from the terminal, entering 'gnome-nettools'
would you wait me a min?.... err I'm updating the apt-get :(
be a bit patient please :-)  so install nettols please; anyway it should be part of the normal ubuntu install. otherwise, you could use the ping command from the terminal
I'll see how to install that brb, and thanks a lot nozorro =)
if you don't install it, enter 'ping your-router-address' in the terminal and tell me what happens
I'm so loser I don't what's my router address....
if you don't know that, then you can't connect to the Internet. Not even under Windows. I'm serious.
the only thing I did in the past in order to connect to internet, was to enable the dhcp in the net configuration :(
so do you have dhcp enabled now for the corresponding network device? Pls look under System | Administration | Networking
